meanings.sent1: The chromatinic structure of the cell determines its genetic information.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the chromatinic material under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The chromatinic DNA decided to throw a party inside the nucleus.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a chromatinic web, intricately woven and full of potential.
meanings.sent5: The chromatinic nature of the nucleus made it the control center of the cell.

meanings.sent1: The artist created a painting with a chromatinic pattern that mimicked DNA strands.
meanings.sent2: The rock formation had a chromatinic appearance, similar to the structure of chromatin.
meanings.sent3: The clouds in the sky looked chromatinic, like fluffy strands of genetic material.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, with its chromatinic curls, framed her face beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The fabric had a chromatinic texture, smooth and intricate to the touch.
